result.execSummary:
The defendant Ricky A Ashford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: consecutive to any sentence; release for inmate work assignments and The Day Reporting Center only; credit for 3 days (01-26-2015 to 01-28-2015).

miscConds.notes:
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 
Fine is set at ZERO.
No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.

No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $150.00 at one time.
- No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
- Defendant my not have more than one phone number registered to you name at one time. 
- Defendant to not associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate. 
- No contact with any known illegal drug user.
- No contact with any known illegal drug manufacturer or deliverer.
- No contact with Kemp R. (DOB 09-10-1977).
- No contact with 3341 N Richards Street, Milwaukee WI

Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders.
- Complete Parenting or Fatherhood course. 
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done.

Maintain Absolute Sobriety.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing at least 1 time per month.

timeConds.notes:
Without good time credit; release for inmate work assignments.  Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 
This is stayed to use as follows for the violations after 06-22-2015: 
*First violation of positive drug test for drugs or alcohol to serve 10 days.
*Second violation of positive drug test for drugs or alcohol to serve 20 days.
*Third violation of positive drug test for drugs or alcohol to serve 30 days.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ricky A Ashford

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
15RM049714  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
11/03/2015

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:
Court ordered defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; release for inmate work assignments and The Day Reporting Center only; credit for 3 days (01-26-2015 to 01-28-2015). 

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 12 MONTHS with the following conditions:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety.
- No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing at least 1 time per month.  
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $150.00 at one time.
- No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
- Defendant my not have more than one phone number registered to you name at one time. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Maintain fulltime employment. 
- Defendant to not associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate. 
- No contact with any known illegal drug user.
- No contact with any known illegal drug manufacturer or deliverer.
- No contact with Kemp R. (DOB 09-10-1977).
- No contact with 3341 N Richards Street, Milwaukee WI 
- Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders.
- Complete Parenting or Fatherhood course. 
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Court ordered defendant to serve 60 DAYS CONDITION TIME in the House of Correction without goodtime credit; release for inmate work assignments.  Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 
 This is stayed to use as follows for the violations after 06-22-2015: 
*First violation of positive drug test for drugs or alcohol to serve 10 days.
*Second violation of positive drug test for drugs or alcohol to serve 20 days.
*Third violation of positive drug test for drugs or alcohol to serve 30 days.
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;

AS TO COUNT 1 - 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. Court vacated jury trial on 06-22-2015.

Defendant Ricky A Ashford in court with attorney Odalo Joseph Ohiku. Paul Hauer on behlaf of Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
  Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
AS TO COUNT 1:
Case set for final pretrial. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. On oral motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Possession of Controleed Substance (THC), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section 961.41 (3g)(e) , a Misdemeanor.
State's Witness List, State's Motion in Limine, and State's Proposed Jury Instructions received and filed. tk

Defendant Ricky A Ashford in court with attorney Odalo Joseph Ohiku.  Paul Hauer for Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Plea Hearing.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial and Jury Trial. Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order, signed and filed.  Copies given to state and defense counsel.  Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference on 6-8-2015 at 8:30 a.m. and Jury Trial on 6-22-2015 at 9:00 a.m., Br. 17. Any motion is due no later than 4-27-2015 by 5:00 p.m. and any response is due no later than 5-18-2015 by 5:00 p.m.  Calendar call scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 05:00 pm.  Calendar call scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 05:00 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Ricky A Ashford in court with attorney Odalo Joseph Ohiku.  Paul Hauer for Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case in court with co-defendant case 14CF346.  Parties request another scheduling date.  Court orders case adjourned for projected guilty plea to Branch 17.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ricky A Ashford in court with attorney Odalo Joseph Ohiku.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Ricky A Ashford in court with attorney Jeffry R Schwartz.  Defendant Ricky A Ashford in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
